raw_comment:
1- This graph shows the percentages of young people who say they reach out to their parents at least once a day or a few times a week. I also notice how young women send texts, phone or video-chat, and visit their parents in person at a higher rate than young men do. 

2- Something I wonder is if social media and technology ruined genuine face-to-face conversations? Or is it because the 18-34 age group lives away from home, in-person visits are unattainable.

3- This relates to my community because I fit the demographics of this study and also feel represented in the data. Also, I get along with nearly everyone I am surrounded with on a regular basis, am in the age range this graphic examines.

4- "Are you chatting ?"
ace_sentences: The graph shows percentages of young people.
These young people say that they reach out to their parents at least once a day or a few times a week.
Young women send texts to their parents at a higher rate than young men do.
Young women phone their parents at a higher rate than young men do.
Young women video-chat with their parents at a higher rate than young men do.
Young women visit their parents in person at a higher rate than young men do.
I wonder whether social media ruins genuine face-to-face conversations.
I wonder whether technology ruins genuine face-to-face conversations.
The 18-34 age group often lives away from home.
If the 18-34 age group lives away from home then in-person visits are unattainable.
I fit the demographics of this study.
I feel represented in the data.
I get along with nearly everyone.
I am surrounded with these people on a regular basis.
I am in the age range that this graphic examines.
The headline is: Are you chatting?
